reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Conservation and Management of Sharks and Rays in the Wider Caribbean Region

description.narrative: Ensure that the environment and the natural resources upon which human lives and livelihoods depend are managed in ways that sustain productivity growth, a healthy population, as well as the intrinsic spiritual and cultural value of the environment.

This award strives to ensure that the environment and the natural resources upon which human lives and livelihoods depend are managed in ways that sustain productivity growth, a healthy population, as well as the intrinsic spiritual and cultural value of the environment. More specifically, this award includes The Western Central Atlantic Fisheries Commission’s (WECAFC) Secretariat is aiming to organize the first meeting of the Sharks Working Group in order to develop a draft Regional Plan of Action (RPOA) for the conservation and management of sharks in the Wider Caribbean Region in compliance with the FAO’s International Plan Of Action-Sharks and the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species Conference Of the Parties 16 meeting decisions. All participants to the meeting will provide appropriate shark catch and population data for their countries in order for an assessment to be done. This information will be used in the development of a draft RPOA. This project will also increase awareness and understanding of shark status, conservation and management among fisheries sector stakeholders of the WECAFC member states..
